column6: For centuries, time was measured by the position of the sun with the use of sundials. Noon was recognized when the sun was the highest in the sky, and cities would set their clock by this apparent solar time, even though some cities would often be on a slightly different time.

column6: Voltaire himself probably won around half a million livres, a large fortune, which he then made even larger in a series of canny investments.
